messages.text: Kim, WAIT!
The door slams behind Neil as he races into the street after Kim.
Come back - I know you don’t want to go back to work right now.
Yeah, well I also don’t want you to give me a ring.
But apparently, I don’t get a say in that, Neil.
This is supposed to be a Kiss Contract.
That means no promises, no expectations.
And you’re giving me a ring?
Kim, relax. It’s not one of THOSE rings.
It might as well be!
You gave me a ring on our first date.
And YES - now I know this really WAS a date.
Seriously Kim?
Is this really so different from your expectations?
Because I’ll tell you what I was expecting.
I thought we could hang out at lunch.
I thought I could give you a few gifts.
Well you thought wrong.
I didn’t want this.
You don’t just give a girl a ring, Neil.
Rings mean something.
They’re kind of a big deal.
So? Is it such a big deal that I like you?
I can’t… I can’t do this.
You’re missing the point entirely.
This Kiss Contract was never gonna work.
I should’ve seen that from a mile away.
Don’t say that, Kim.
Wasn’t the whole purpose of the Kiss Contract to have fun?
Yeah… so?
So… ??
Weren’t you having fun today?
I mean before this whole thing with the ring happened.
Kim pauses for a second, considering Neil’s words.
Yeah, I guess.
Kim, you got to tease me about the food I was eating.
That alone puts this day in your top ten.
Kim reaches out her hand with a small smile on her lips,
Stretching for Neil’s hand.
She wraps her fingers around each of his,
Toying with his digits one by one.
You know I like teasing you.
Now you’re teasing me in a different way.
Yes - but I always give in when I tease you this way…
I always do -
This?
Neil cuts her off, capturing her mouth with his.
He plants his hands on her hips - with just enough force to take control.
The kiss is passionate and consuming,
And a soft moan escapes from Kim’s mouth.
When he pulls away, it takes Kim a moment to find her voice.
Yes, that.
You don’t want me to stop doing that all because of a silly ring - do you?
No, I guess not.
But that ring made me feel uncomfortable
And I don’t like feeling that way around you.
I know. I don’t like it either.
Here’s the thing…
I got you that ring because I wanted to show you that I appreciate you.
I went to Chanel because my sister likes that store - she said girls like it.
And when I got there…
I picked out the most non-romantic looking piece of jewelry I could find.
A ring?
A NAIL shaped ring, Kim.
This ring looks like a nail you’d hammer into a wall.
But there’s something artistic about it, so I thought you might like it.
And I thought it might at least make you laugh.
Because that’s all I wanted to do -
I wanted to make you smile.
So now, tell me the truth -
Because that’s rule #2, after all.
If there are no promises, no expectations…
Kim watches Neil slide the ring on her finger,
And it fits perfectly, like it was made for her hand.
Do you like it, Kim?
Does it make you smile?
Kim looks up from the ring and into Neil’s eyes.
Yes - I like it very much.
Then let’s get some lunch.
That bone marrow was NOT very filling.
A few hours later, Kim is back at work
And happily drawing in her new sketchpad,
When she gets interrupted by a strange call.
She opens her IB, as she always does after strange calls, and IB’s Neil.
You’ll NEVER guess what just happened.
Is it good or because it’s bad?
IDK - it’s just weird.
Lol, what is it?
BRAD called me down to his office.
Isn’t that so bizarre?
I was planning to just co-exist with him and avoid him at all costs
Yeah, well I’m sure he wasn’t going to follow that plan, Kim.
What do you mean?
I mean that he’s a guy who wanted to be with you.
He’s probably going to try to find a way to win you back.
What?! Don’t be ridiculous.
He hates my guts. Remember what a jerk he was this morning?
He was a jerk because he can’t be with you.
God, I hate this guy.
He’s seriously is calling you into his office?
That’s a total dick move.
He’s just trying to put himself in a position of authority.
Neil, please.
I’m serious, Kim. Be careful.
Don’t let him abuse his position.
His HR position?
Weren’t you the one who said that HR people can’t possibly get “hot and heavy?”
That was before you and I had the Kiss Contract.
He wants to get with you.
Hmmm… maybe.
But it’s not like I’m going to let him.
Kiss Contract Rule #1, remember?
No kissing anyone who isn’t on the list.
Okay. Thank you.
Haha, you don’t have to thank me.
Anyway, I better go - I want to get this over with.
Good luck.
Let me know what happens.
Kim walks down the hall. After she turns the corner,
She can immediately see into Brad’s glass office.
And sitting in the chairs are two of the brokers -
The one from the Apple deal, and the one from this morning’s Microsoft deal.
Kim tentatively knocks on the door and Brad raises his hand, beckoning her in.
Ms. Blake! Have a seat.
Oh, it’s no trouble, I can stand.
No, please. I’d like you to sit for this.
Kim lowers herself into the seat slowly,
Looking back and forth between the brokers,
And finally, back to Brad.
He straightens his tie and clears his throat.
Ms. Blake, we’re going to have to let you go.
